Step 1: Choose an encryption password.

Choose a safe password to encrypt the IPFS hash of your documents. This password will be required by any external individual who tries to access your files or documents.

Step 2: Upload your desired document.

The IPFS hash for this document will be saved with AES-encryption. For more information, please read the documentation.

Step 3: Sign the document with your wallet.

You will need MetaMask or a similar ethereum enabled browser in order to complete this step. Clicking "I agree" should open MetaMask and request you to submit a transaction for zero ether. There will be a gas cost for this transaction, likely between $0.03 and $0.30.

Signing will associate your ethereum address with this document publically on the blockchain.

Step 4: Share your encrypted link.

Your transaction may take a few minutes to process on the Ethereum network.
